excerpt: HBO is booking another stay at 'The White Lotus': The luxury vacation dramedy has been renewed for a fourth season.
text: HBO is booking another stay at The White Lotus: The luxury vacation dramedy has been renewed for a fourth season, the network announced on Wednesday, a month before the Season 3 premiere. Each season of The White Lotus introduces a new cast of characters who are staying at a new location in the fictional White Lotus luxury hotel chain. Season 3 — premiering Sunday, Feb. 16 at 9/8c on HBO — is set in Thailand, with Walton Goggins, Parker Posey and Carrie Coon leading the ensemble cast. Natasha Rothwell will also reprise her Season 1 role as spa manager Belinda. (Watch a trailer here.) Mike White serves as writer and director on The White Lotus, which debuted on HBO in 2021. Season 1, set in Hawaii, earned 20 Emmy nominations, with wins for best limited series and for Murray Bartlett and Jennifer Coolidge for best supporting actor and actress in a limited series. Season 2, set in Sicily, moved to the drama categories at the Emmys and earned another 23 nods, with Coolidge winning again, this time for best supporting actress in a drama series. HBO is booking another stay at The White Lotus: The luxury vacation dramedy has been renewed for a fourth season, the network announced on Wednesday, a month before the Season 3 premiere.

Each season of The White Lotus introduces a new cast of characters who are staying at a new location in the fictional White Lotus luxury hotel chain. Season 3 — premiering Sunday, Feb. 16 at 9/8c on HBO — is set in Thailand, with Walton Goggins, Parker Posey and Carrie Coon leading the ensemble cast. Natasha Rothwell will also reprise her Season 1 role as spa manager Belinda. (Watch a trailer here.)

Mike White serves as writer and director on The White Lotus, which debuted on HBO in 2021. Season 1, set in Hawaii, earned 20 Emmy nominations, with wins for best limited series and for Murray Bartlett and Jennifer Coolidge for best supporting actor and actress in a limited series. Season 2, set in Sicily, moved to the drama categories at the Emmys and earned another 23 nods, with Coolidge winning again, this time for best supporting actress in a drama series.
